body:
We will need a minimal reproduction case in order to look at this further. Without knowing which files are being used and what warnings might be in them, there’s not enough info to determine anything.

Is this in a public repo? If not, can you create a minimal repro case in a public repo so we can see the problem in action?

I can create a minimal repo if it helps, but my report refers to a error missing from ESLint, not a linting error per se, so it applies to any repo using ESLint.

I'll try to explain: I think running the CLI without any positional parameter (no dir or file whatsoever), in any installation of ESLint, should give the ESLint (not linting) error `'patterns' must be a non-empty string or an array of non-empty strings` and it does not, as explained in the issue.

Let me know if something else is needed.

Ah, I see what you mean. I couldn’t quite figure out what you meant by “positional parameter” but now I see that you mean no glob patterns were passed on the command line. Thanks for explaining.

yes, this seems like a bug. We would appreciate a PR if you’re up for it.
Oops! It looks like we lost track of this issue. @eslint/eslint-tsc what do we want to do here? This issue will auto-close in 7 days without an update.
I will do this as part of new config system work.

Something apparently made its way to the codebase at some point and is annoying me.

I used to have the following in my `package.json`:
`"lint:js:staged": "eslint $(git diff --cached --name-only --relative -- '*.js') ,`

Then, to avoid an error when no modifed JS file existed, I added a trailing empty argument:
`"lint:js:staged": "eslint $(git diff --cached --name-only --relative -- '*.js') ''",`

But this trick doesn't work anymore.
How to make eslint exit smoothly if the file selection is empty, now?
@drzraf please start a discussion or stop by Discord for this type of question.

Aside from discussing on Discord, I think it's an actual bug (or rather disappeared feature). Don't you think the former behavior were failing safe was privileged over argument validation/consistency would be desirable.
`eslint` being a tool used within editors, command-line & CI, I do think there is a significant advantage to handle the absence of file arguments.

### Environment

Node version:  v19.1.0
npm version: 8.19.3 (actually using pnpm 7.18.2)
Local ESLint version:  8.30.0
Operating System: Windows 11 WSL2


### What parser are you using?

Default (Espree)

### What did you do?

I have some `turbo` repo default project template the latest one (`apps` and `packages` mono repo structure).
I've removed everything `eslint` related and reinstalled all dependencies in `apps` and `packages` folders.
I've created `eslint.config.js` in the root of the project and set `lint` script like:
```
"lint": "ESLINT_USE_FLAT_CONFIG=true eslint --debug -c eslint.config.mjs"
```
Tried various configurations with `files` and `ignores` patterns, nothing works, I'm getting `eslint:flat-eslint 0 files found`


### What did you expect to happen?

I'm expecting to lint all files I've set glob pattern and ignore those that are set for ignoring with glob pattern.

### What actually happened?

No files are matched.

### Participation

- [ ] I am willing to submit a pull request for this issue.

### Additional comments

```
  eslint:cli CLI args: [ '--debug', '-c', 'eslint.config.mjs' ] +0ms
  eslint:cli Using flat config? true +2ms
  eslint:cli Running on files +3ms
  eslint:flat-eslint Override config file path is eslint.config.mjs +0ms
  eslint:flat-eslint Loading config from /home/igor/projects/turbo-vinyl/eslint.config.mjs +1ms
```

body:
Should we throw an error, or use the config file to determine which files to lint - per the [RFC](https://github.com/eslint/rfcs/blob/main/designs/2019-config-simplification/README.md):

> Additionally, ESLint can be run without specifying anything on the command line, relying just on what's in `eslint.config.js` to determine what to lint:
> 
> ```bash
> eslint
> ```
>
> This will go into the `eslint.config.js` and use all of the `files` glob patterns to determine which files to lint.

I believe the latter would mean that when no positional arguments (file/dir/glob lint targets) are specified, the default is `["."]`.

Sound fine to handle omission or file arguments by use of a default argument **if** there were a way to "fail-safe" **too**. Eg: If the ` ""`  empty argument (or a `--`  or a non-existing file) would not trigger an error.

> I believe the latter would mean that when no positional arguments (file/dir/glob lint targets) are specified, the default is ["."].

Not exactly. It would mean that ESLint wouldn't assuming anything and instead take all of the `files` patterns from `eslint.config.js` and use those as the glob patterns. So `files:["**/*.js"]` plus `eslint` equals `eslint **/*.js`.

> Something annoying apparently made its way to the codebase.
> 
> I used to have the following in my `package.json`: `"lint:js:staged": "eslint $(git diff --cached --name-only --relative -- '*.js') ,`
> 
> Then, to avoid an error when no modifed JS file existed, I added a trailing empty argument: `"lint:js:staged": "eslint $(git diff --cached --name-only --relative -- '*.js') ''",`
> 
> But this trick doesn't work anymore. How to make eslint exit smoothly if the file selection is empty, now?

I still think there is room for a smart usage of `--` as way to say: `Disregard "." and only consider the following as filespecs. If none, succeed.`

This issue describes the implementation plan for eslint/rfcs#9, which will take place in several phases:

## Phase 1: Extract current config system

- [x] Create new GitHub repository (`eslint/eslintrc`)
- [x] Copy`eslintrc` source files and tests into new GitHub repository
- [x] Create Jenkins release job for `@eslint/eslintrc`
- [x] Publish `@eslint/eslintrc` to npm
- [x] Update ESLint to use `@eslint/eslintrc`
- [x] Remove in-memory filesystem from tests
- [x] Update `CLIEngine` to use `CascadingConfigArrayFactory` from `@eslint/eslintrc`

## Phase 2: Implement flat config with `eslintrc` compatibility

- [x] Create the `FlatCompat` class in `eslint/eslintrc` repository
- [x] Create `FlatConfigArray` to represent simple configs
- [x] Update `Linter` class to understand `FlatConfigArray` objects
- [x] Ensure `Linter#defineRule` and `Linter#definePlugin` throw errors when using `FlatConfigArray`
- [x] Add `context.languageOptions` in backwards-compatible way to `context` in `Linter`
- [x] Ensure `context.parserPath` still works in `Linter` for `FlatConfigArray` (for now)
- [x] Create `FlatRuleTester` to allow rule testing with `FlatConfigArray` format
- [x] Create `FlatESLint` class to mirror `ESLint` class but use `eslint.config.js` instead
- [x] #15661

- [x] #15687
- [x] Implement caching
- [x] Update `cli.js` to search for `eslint.config.js` file and use `FlatESLint` if found (`ESLint` if not)
- [x] Ensure invalid CLI flags cause errors when using flat config (for example, `--resolve-plugins-relative-to`)
- [x] Switch `eslint/eslint` repo to use flat config
- [x] Document flat config
- [x] Release ESLint with `eslintrc` compatibility
- [x] #16416

## Phase 3: Compatibility testing

- [ ] Work with `typescript-eslint` to switch to new format and ensure it works correctly ([pull request](https://github.com/typescript-eslint/typescript-eslint/pull/6836))
- [ ] Work with `eslint-plugin-import` to switch to new format and ensure it works correctly (@mdjermanovic) https://github.com/import-js/eslint-plugin-import/pull/2829 https://github.com/import-js/eslint-plugin-import/pull/2873
- [ ] Work with `eslint-config-airbnb` to switch to new format and ensure it works correctly (@mdjermanovic)

- [x] Work with `eslint-plugin-n` to switch configs to new format and ensure it works correctly (@mdjermanovic) ([pull request](https://github.com/eslint-community/eslint-plugin-n/pull/95))
- [ ] Work with `eslint-plugin-vue` to switch configs to new format and ensure it works correctly ([pull request](https://github.com/vuejs/eslint-plugin-vue/pull/2226))
- [ ] Work with `eslint-plugin-react` to switch configs to new format and ensure it works correctly (@mdjermanovic) ([pull request](https://github.com/jsx-eslint/eslint-plugin-react/pull/3600))
- [x] Switch ESLint config to load external configs/plugins without `FlatCompat`
- [x] Release ESLint with extended compatibility

## Phase 4: General availability (v9.0.0)

- [x] Write blog post about flat config format
- [x] Output warning when people use `eslintrc` files
- [x] Switch documentation so `eslint.config.js` is the default and recommended format (link to legacy `eslintrc` docs from the same page)
- [x] Switch `Linter` to use flat config by default

> I believe the latter would mean that when no positional arguments (file/dir/glob lint targets) are specified, the default is `["."]`.

Agree with that. Feels quite intuitive 👍 

Just happened that one of our packages was successfully linting a package for years because we missed the `.` in `eslint .`. 

`eslint` should either 
- lint `.` (or `files` parameter in eslint config)
- exit with an error `no parameter passed`

Current behavior is misleading.

<!--
    The following is required for all pull requests:
-->

#### What changes did you make? (Give an overview)

When running the CLI without file arguments it silently fails right now. This PR makes the following changes:

* When running the CLI in eslintrc mode, failing to use file arguments throws an error.
* When running the CLI in flat config mode, failing to use file arguments means that it runs on the current working directory.

Fixes #14308



#### Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?

To make this work, I changed how `lintFiles()` works in both `ESLint` and `FlatESLint`. In `FlatESLint`, I decided that an empty string and an empty array are the same and should be treated as `.`. I'm not sure if that's the right decision, so I'd like to hear some opinions on that.
